reviews.text: Got a good rate which made the one night stay a very good value; very friendly staff--particularly the valet staff. Smallish room but view made up for it. Just walk to the waterfront restaurants or uphill to Broadway restaurants. Nice pool/exercise room; waterfront walk/run path.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location in downtown near shops and public transpo (1 block from airport train stop). Average rooms, kinda on the loud side (noise from the hallways, doors slamming, etc.). NIce views from our 17th floor room. Polite staff. No mini bar in room. Beds comfortable, but not the best I've had. Overall, good choice for the money.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three days in Portland, and this hotel had great access to downtown. It faced the river and we jogged each day on the paths by the water.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel went out of their way to accommodate us. We arrived shortly after noon and they offered us a room without a balcony. I mentioned that we had booked a room with a balcony, and they cleaned one and had it ready in approximately an hour after we returned from lunch. The room was spacious and clean, with a large flat-screen TV and a comfortable chair. It also had a good desk with work space for the business traveler.
reviews.title: Flawless overnight

likes.disliked: — No way to access the Internet without shelling out big bucks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel to both leisure and business travellers.
reviews.title: Another Marriott Does Not Disappoint!

reviews.text: Great location, right next to the waterfront and some nice, yet affordable restaurants (and convenient to the zoo, which is excellent). The staff was great. An assistant manager on duty took 20 minutes talking to us about good restaurants, how to navigate the downtown transportation system and interesting places to go. All of the staff members were friendly -- they seemed really glad to have us as guests. Comfortable beds, comfortable rooms. We'll certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great staff

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, very nice, clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: there are 2 marriot properties downtown portland- this one is the waterfront property and the other is on broadway. if you want to be centrally located, the broadway property is a better location. downtown portland is so small though that even staying by the water you can still easily walk to most places (we walked to the pearl dist from this property) and you can catch a tram to get anywhere you need to go. the remodel was well done and the property is very nice- the lobby is nice, the staff friendly, and the rooms were very nice. comfy beds with down comforters, flat-screen tvs and even good artwork. the hotel was very quiet- we didnt hear anything thankfully. my only peeve with the hotel is that they charge quite a bit for wi-fi and they even charge for it in their business center (nothing complimentary in regard to internet access at this hotel). business travelers who i have spoken with say that this is common, but i travel for pleasure all the time and have never been charged for internet access. in this day and age it should really be free-- what, they arent making enough off of room service anymore?
reviews.title: Nice remodeled hotel
Good, as expected
reviews.text: As usual, you can always count on Marriott. We had a free nights stay certificate. They let us check in early and check out late. Very clean, high class room. A little small though, but it was fine for one night. Plasma TV which was nice. Good shower. All around a great spot with a good location.

This waterfront hotel is in a great location for wandering the lovely downtown commercial center of Portland. The expected Marriott quality does not disappoint, and the views of the river are stunning, especially at night.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: This hotel is right across the street from the river in downtown Portland. The location is perfect - near everything downtown has to offer and right across from the walking/jogging/running path that goes for at least 3-4 miles along the river.
reviews.title: Great location with views of the river

reviews.text: This is a large, older hotel but has been nicely renovated. The rooms are small, but nicely decorated and comfortable. Get a river view if at all possible.
reviews.title: Spoil Yourself! It Is My Home Away From Home

reviews.text: There is only valet parking, so be prepared for that. The valet attendants were courteous and prompt.
reviews.title: Good rates online - comfy beds - self-parking reasonable

likes.liked: — Price online, self parking cost rather than $24 valet
